description: This small parrot is sexually dimorphic. They are primarily greyish-brown with green feathers on the back. Males have a striking bright orange or red belly, while the female's belly is grey.
temperament: Playful, curious, and intelligent. They can be a bit shy and reserved with strangers but form strong bonds with their chosen person. They are active and enjoy playing with toys.
loudness: Quiet to Moderate. They are not screamers but have a range of whistles and chirps that can get loud when they are excited or alarmed.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-green-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Quiet"><title>Quiet</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Can be decent talkers, learning several words and phrases. They are also great at mimicking sounds like microwaves and phones.
dietaryNeeds: A balanced diet of pellets, fresh vegetables, and a small amount of fruit. Like their cousins, they should have a low-fat diet.
healthPointers: A hardy species with a lifespan of 20-30 years. Ensure a varied diet to prevent vitamin deficiencies and provide plenty of chewable toys to keep their beak healthy.
housing: A great choice for apartment dwellers. A cage of at least 24"W x 18"D x 24"H will give them room to play.
